issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h5.Description

When using a picker, the selector can be positioned to be between the bottom two items in the picker, this appears to only be possible on a iPhone 6 Plus, as on a iPad Air 2, iPhone 6 and iPhone 5S the issue cannot be reproduced. 

*Notes*

This *is not* a regression
I am unable to recreate the issue using a picker in a native application

h5.Steps To Reproduce

1. Run the attached app.js on an iPhone 6 Plus
2. Position the item selector between the bottom two items

h5.Actual Result

The selector will stay between both items 

h5.Expected Result

The selector should move to an item above or below it
fields.summary: iPhone 6 Plus: The picker row can be set to be between items
fields.environment:
Mac OSX 10.10.1
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.4.1.201410281743
Titanium SDK build:   3.5.0.v20141215113314
Titanium CLI, build: 3.4.1

iPhone 6 Plus (8.1)
